de.awi.floenavigation.services

Class ValidationService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • android.app.IntentService
            • de.awi.floenavigation.services.ValidationService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class ValidationService
extends android.app.IntentService
    An IntentService subclass for handling asynchronous task requests in a service on a separate handler thread.

    ValidationService service is used for handling algorithm to detect sea ice break. The algorithm works by checking/comparing received positions DatabaseHelper.recvdLatitude, DatabaseHelper.recvdLongitude and predicted positions DatabaseHelper.latitude and DatabaseHelper.longitude of the fixed stations DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable. If the distance is greater than PredictionService.ERROR_THRESHOLD_VALUE for PredictionService.PREDICTION_ACCURACY_THRESHOLD_VALUE, then the algorithm states that the fixed station has been broken off and its mmsi is removed from the database table. For this to happen at least 3 valid ais packets should be available. However there is a caveat to it, if the broken fixed station is origin or the x-axis fixed station although it is removed from the DatabaseHelper.stationListTable the PredictionService service predicts its values, by providing it a new mmsi value, this is done so that the grid remains intact

    TODO: Customize class - update intent actions and extra parameters.

      • onHandleIntent

        protected void onHandleIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
        This method is invoked on the worker thread Runnable is set to periodically run at VALIDATION_TIME msecs. The algorithm works in the following manner, necessary parameter values for each fixed station is retrieved from the database table DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable, then the difference between the received and the predicted values are compared, if the error crosses beyond ERROR_THRESHOLD_VALUE,

        - DatabaseHelper.incorrectMessageCount is incremented based on the DatabaseHelper.updateTime and the DatabaseHelper.validationCheckTime - Also DatabaseHelper.predictionAccuracy is incremented - if the DatabaseHelper.predictionAccuracy crosses PREDICTION_ACCURACY_THRESHOLD_VALUE / VALIDATION_TIME and the DatabaseHelper.incorrectMessageCount is more than or equal to MAX_NUM_OF_VALID_PACKETS then a dialog box is displayed and the fixed station enry is removed from the database

        if stopRunnable is true, the runnable is stopped until setStopRunnable(boolean) with false value is not received from SyncActivity.stopServices() and SetupActivity.runServices(android.content.Context)
        Specified by:
        onHandleIntent in class android.app.IntentService
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent
        intent - Intent

      • updataMMSIInDBTables

        private void updataMMSIInDBTables(int mmsi,
                                  android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                                  boolean originFlag)
        If the recovered fixed stations are part of the original base stations which were used to setup the initial grid then the mmsi's for those stations are assigned or values such that the predictions for these stations are in progress and can be redeployed at a different point in the grid even though these are recovered
        Parameters:
        mmsi - mmsi to be recovered
        db - SQLiteDatabase instance
        originFlag - true if the mmsi is of the origin base station
